title: HPI 39 - The Wolf’s Footprint - Indian Naturalism
itunes:title: HPI 39 - The Wolf’s Footprint - Indian Naturalism
description: The Cārvāka or Lokāyata tradition rejects the efficacy of ritual and belief in the afterlife, and restricts knowledge to the realm of sense-perception.
content:encoded: The Cārvāka or Lokāyata tradition rejects the efficacy of ritual and belief in the afterlife, and restricts knowledge to the realm of sense-perception.
itunes:subtitle: The Cārvāka or Lokāyata tradition rejects the efficacy of ritual and belief in the afterlife, and restricts knowledge to the realm of sense-perception.
itunes:summary: The Cārvāka or Lokāyata tradition rejects the efficacy of ritual and belief in the afterlife, and restricts knowledge to the realm of sense-perception.
itunes:author: Peter Adamson, Jonardon Ganeri, Chike Jeffers
